image.caption: Image courtesy of the Library of Congress

profileText: A Representative from Florida; born in Jacksonville, Fla., October 19, 1868; attended the public schools and the Duval High School; engaged in mercantile pursuits; became editor and publisher of Dixie, a weekly newspaper; elected as a Democrat to the Sixty-third Congress (March 4, 1913-March 3, 1915); unsuccessful candidate for renomination in 1914 to the Sixty-fourth Congress; again engaged in journalism; died in Jacksonville, Duval County, Fla., November 6, 1919; interment in Evergreen Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1910-1919, 1 linear foot.
researchRecord.description: Collection includes correspondence, newspapers, articles, stories, and drafts.

researchRecord.name: Claude L'Engle Scrapbook, 1907, 1 volume.
researchRecord.description: The scrapbook contains news clippings covering the trial of Graham v. L'Engle, 1907.

researchRecord.name: In the Dorothy Dodd Gifts, 1903-1907, 12 items.
researchRecord.description: Collection includes letter from Claude L'Engle.

recordLocation.name: Robert Manning Stozier Library, Special Collections
